p: At the same time, Urbanowicz et al. (2016) also found that A82V increased infectivity of human cell lines and decreased infectivity of bat cell lines ‘ supporting the hypothesis that A82V is a fitness adaptation’. However, a follow-up study failed to find evidence of the mutation conferring higher viral titres or shedding rates in experimental infection of macaques ( Marzi et al. 2018). The reason for this discrepancy between live animal models and cell lines is not yet understood, which means the functional significance of the A82V replacement remains unresolved.
